content.question: Which of the following best explains why trade along the trans-Saharan trade networks increased in the period 1200â€“1450 ?

choices.label: Innovations in previously existing transportation technologies, such as the caravan, allowed merchants to carry larger loads and protect themselves.
The introduction of new commercial technologies, such as the compass, made it easier for merchants to find their destinations in the desert.
The expansion of banking houses made it easier for merchants to fund their commercial activities.
